summary:
Having started as a District Medical Officer in the beginning of the eigthies in Mozambique, I did my MasterÂ´s in Health Development in Antwerp (ITG) and worked for 5 years at KIT - Royal Tropical Institute in Amsterdam on integration of vertical programmes in the general health systems in Southern Africa. From 1990 to 2000 I first worked for Danida as Chief Technical Aadvisor on the national program for Mother and child health and thereafter as Health Advisor for the Irish Embassy. From 2000 to 2005 I joined KIT again as head of the Health systems Development Section and returned to Mozambique first as country rep of Oxfam and later as health advisor for the Danish government. As from August 2009 I returned to the Netherlands and started a new job at KNCV/Tuberculosis Foundation as senior consultant Health systems strengthening. I left KNCV in May 2015 and work now on free lance basis.

Specialties: Health Systems Strengthening, Human Resources Development, SWAps, Budget support, Health Sector Reform
